phases.title: Add Start Claude button to sidebar and wire terminal command
phases.content:
Create a 'Start Claude' button at the bottom of the sidebar panel in App.tsx. The button should:
1. Be positioned at the bottom-left of the sidebar using flexbox layout
2. When clicked, write 'claude --dangerously-skip-permissions\n' to the active terminal via invoke('write_terminal')
3. Get the active terminal ID from the terminal store
4. Style the button to match the existing UI (blue accent theme)

Files to modify:
- apps/desktop/src/App.tsx - Add the button in the sidebar, restructure sidebar-content to use flex with footer
- apps/desktop/src/components/layout/layout.css - Add styles for sidebar-sections, sidebar-footer, and the button

Implementation approach:
- Restructure sidebar-content div to have two children: sidebar-sections (scrollable, flex:1) and sidebar-footer (fixed at bottom)
- Import useTerminalStore and invoke in App.tsx
- Create onClick handler that reads activeTabId from store, finds the tab's activeTerminalId, then calls invoke('write_terminal')
- Add CSS for the footer area with a subtle top border and the button styling
verification: The button appears at the bottom-left of the sidebar
Clicking the button pastes 'claude --dangerously-skip-permissions' into the active terminal
The command executes in the terminal (newline appended)
The button has appropriate styling matching the app theme
Existing sidebar scrolling still works with many items
